result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan R Davey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1: 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1093


The total, $2186, is to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 6/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 44 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2: 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1093

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan R Davey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:27pm [mo]
Defendant Alan R Davey in court with Attorney Mark B Hazelbaker.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall orally motions to amend Count #1 to Theft by Fraud contrary to 943.20(1)(d), a class A misdemeanor and Count #2 to Theft, less that $2500, contrary to 943.20(1)(a), a class A misdemeanor
--The Court grants this motion to amend

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on the amended Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1: 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1093

On Count #2: 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500+ costs = $1093

The total, $2186, is to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 6/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 44 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
recess: 1:36pm
Ok subject to DA Verifying Victim's Rights Compliance RRK - cc: Atty's
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
from Attorney Hazelbaker to reschedule the pretrial date

On Defendant's Request to reschedule Pretrial Conference:

OK
Status conference on May 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
from Attorney Hazelbaker requesting the 4/8/16 pretrial be rescheduled

Attorney Hazelbaker
Appearance and Notice of Retainer
Cover Letter for Notice of Retainer from Attorney Hazelbaker. Attorney Hazelbaker also advises that his client will be making a voluntary appearance on 2/15/16.
Defendant made voluntary appearance // Court quashes warrant

MK] case called at 11:09am. 
Defendant Alan R Davey in court with Attorney Mark B Hazelbaker.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

This is a Voluntary Appearance by Mr. Davey.  The Court quashes the Warrant. 

Mr. Davey indicates that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  His address is:  PO Box 125, Larson, WI.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Rob's Motorsports
--no contact with Robert Strauss or any employee of Rob's Motorsports
--no presence at the Aztalan Motorcross Speedway
--no possession of any financial cards or financial instruments not in his name 
recess 11:14am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/9/16 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 4/8/16 at 2:00pm
